intro: Odontarrhena smolikana subsp. glabra, commonly known as the smooth odontarrhena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky outcrops, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a pale pink to white color. This subspecies is notable for its adaptability to arid conditions and its role in local ecosystems.
